option.name: --no-interaction

option.name: --profile

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: archive
command.description: Create an archive of this composer package
command.help:
The <info>archive</info> command creates an archive of the specified format containing the files and directories of the Composer project or the specified package in the specified version and writes it to the specified directory.
<info>php composer.phar archive [--format=zip] [--dir=/foo] [package [version]]</info>

argument.name: package
argument.description: The package to archive instead of the current project

option.name: --format
option.description: Format of the resulting archive: tar or zip

option.name: --dir
option.description: Write the archive to this directory

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: config
command.help:
This command allows you to edit some basic composer settings in either the local composer.json file or the global config.json file.
To edit the global config.json file:
<comment>composer.phar config --global</comment>
To add a repository:
<comment>composer.phar config repositories.foo vcs http://bar.com</comment>
You can add a repository to the global config.json file by passing in the <info>--global</info> option.
To edit the file in an external editor:
<comment>composer.phar config --editor</comment>
To choose your editor you can set the "EDITOR" env variable.
To get a list of configuration values in the file:
<comment>composer.phar config --list</comment>
You can always pass more than one option. As an example, if you want to edit the global config.json file.
<comment>composer.phar config --editor --global</comment>

option.name: --global
option.description: Apply command to the global config file

option.name: --file
option.description: If you want to choose a different composer.json or config.json

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: create-project
command.description: Create new project from a package into given directory.
command.help:
The <info>create-project</info> command creates a new project from a given package into a new directory. You can use this command to bootstrap new projects or setup a clean version-controlled installation for developers of your project.
<info>php composer.phar create-project vendor/project target-directory [version]</info>
You can also specify the version with the package name using = or : as separator.
To install unstable packages, either specify the version you want, or use the --stability=dev (where dev can be one of RC, beta, alpha or dev).
To setup a developer workable version you should create the project using the source controlled code by appending the <info>'--prefer-source'</info> flag. Also, it is advisable to install all dependencies required for development by appending the <info>'--dev'</info> flag.
To install a package from another repository than the default one you can pass the <info>'--repository-url=http://myrepository.org'</info> flag.

argument.name: directory
argument.description: Directory where the files should be created

option.name: --stability
option.description: Minimum-stability allowed (unless a version is specified).

option.name: --prefer-source
option.description: Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.

option.name: --prefer-dist
option.description: Forces installation from package dist even for dev versions.

option.name: --repository-url
option.description: Pick a different repository url to look for the package.

option.name: --dev
option.description: Whether to install dependencies for development.

option.name: --no-scripts
option.description: Whether to prevent execution of all defined scripts in the root package.

option.name: --keep-vcs
option.description: Whether to prevent deletion vcs folder.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: depends
command.description: Shows which packages depend on the given package
command.help:
Displays detailed information about where a package is referenced.
<info>php composer.phar depends composer/composer</info>

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: diagnose
command.description: Diagnoses the system to identify common errors.
command.help: The <info>diagnose</info> command checks common errors to help debugging problems.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

option.name: --optimize
option.description: Optimizes PSR0 packages to be loaded with classmaps too, good for production.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: help
command.help:
The <info>help</info> command displays help for a given command:
<info>php composer.phar help list</info>
You can also output the help as XML by using the <comment>--xml</comment> option:
<info>php composer.phar help --xml list</info>
To display the list of available commands, please use the <info>list</info> command.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: init
command.description: Creates a basic composer.json file in current directory.
command.help:
The <info>init</info> command creates a basic composer.json file in the current directory.
<info>php composer.phar init</info>

option.name: --require
option.description: Package to require with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"

option.name: --require-dev
option.description: Package to require for development with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"

option.name: --stability
option.description: Minimum stability (empty or one of: stable, RC, beta, alpha, dev)

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: install
command.description: Installs the project dependencies from the composer.lock file if present, or falls back on the composer.json.
command.help:
The <info>install</info> command reads the composer.lock file from the current directory, processes it, and downloads and installs all the libraries and dependencies outlined in that file. If the file does not exist it will look for composer.json and do the same.
<info>php composer.phar install</info>

option.name: --prefer-source
option.description: Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.

option.name: --prefer-dist
option.description: Forces installation from package dist even for dev versions.

option.name: --dry-run
option.description: Outputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).

option.name: --no-dev
option.description: Disables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for sanity).

option.name: --no-scripts
option.description: Skips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: list
command.help:
The <info>list</info> command lists all commands:
<info>php composer.phar list</info>
You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:
<info>php composer.phar list test</info>
You can also output the information as XML by using the <comment>--xml</comment> option:
<info>php composer.phar list --xml</info>
It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):
<info>php composer.phar list --raw</info>

command.name: require
command.description: Adds required packages to your composer.json and installs them
command.help:
The require command adds required packages to your composer.json and installs them
If you do not want to install the new dependencies immediately you can call it with --no-update

argument.name: packages
argument.description: Required package with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"

option.name: --prefer-source
option.description: Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.

option.name: --prefer-dist
option.description: Forces installation from package dist even for dev versions.

option.name: --no-update
option.description: Disables the automatic update of the dependencies.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: run-script
command.description: Run the scripts defined in composer.json.
command.help:
The <info>run-script</info> command runs scripts defined in composer.json:
<info>php composer.phar run-script post-update-cmd</info>

command.name: self-update
command.description: Updates composer.phar to the latest version.
command.help:
The <info>self-update</info> command checks getcomposer.org for newer versions of composer and if found, installs the latest.
<info>php composer.phar self-update</info>

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.help: The status command displays a list of dependencies that have been modified locally.

command.name: update
command.description: Updates your dependencies to the latest version according to composer.json, and updates the composer.lock file.
command.help:
The <info>update</info> command reads the composer.json file from the current directory, processes it, and updates, removes or installs all the dependencies.
<info>php composer.phar update</info>
To limit the update operation to a few packages, you can list the package(s) you want to update as such:
<info>php composer.phar update vendor/package1 foo/mypackage [...]</info>

argument.name: packages
argument.description: Packages that should be updated, if not provided all packages are.

option.name: --prefer-source
option.description: Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.

option.name: --prefer-dist
option.description: Forces installation from package dist even for dev versions.

option.name: --dry-run
option.description: Outputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).

option.name: --dev
option.description: Enables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for sanity).

option.name: --no-scripts
option.description: Skips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.description: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.description: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
